revised_title: Uniform Rearrangement and Defectiveness in Crystals
tldr: The authors introduce a set of tensor densities to measure defectiveness in a solid crystal and demonstrate a version of elastic-plastic decomposition. They show that uniform rearrangements, which involve dividing, translating, and reassembling a crystal, can be used to understand the relationship between plasticity theory and crystal defects. This work provides a rigorous connection between the kinematics of plasticity and the theory of continuous distributions of dislocations.
